page.title: 16BENTILEE COUNCIL ESTATE
page.content: Bentilee estate is a large,elongated council development built in the l950's on what was generally farmland between Bucknall and the Fenton/Longton built up areas.Apart from local re-housing, some of the original inhabitants were miners having moved here with their families from other parts of Britain, to work in local pits.This is true also of the Berry Hill Council Estate lying between Bentilee Estate and Eaton Park. The estate has its own shopping precinct,a health clinic,a day care centre,a library,three primary and one secondary school and two churches. Amenities have more recently been improved by the provision of a state day nursery,a sub-police station at Bucknall and landscaping of green spaces and play areas.As the houses were built without garages,some parking areas and garages have been provided.
